Comment: A team game I finished very recently, 7 days per move. Very exciting game.
I have recently become addicted to Greek Gift sacrifices, and this seems to be the best way of trying to reach them. Does anyone have any suggestions to help?

!?!?!?! My first impulse was: that's NOT FAIR! The creative part of me considers it shockingly bad form to decline such a brilliant sacrifice which the other player has put so much thought into. This made me really annoyed. Granted, I win a pawn...but that's all.
Fine. Back again.

That's one of the ways I win a knight. Obviously the central one is the one I go for: the other is defended.
It is beyond me why Black is allowing White to go on an exchanging spree. It is usually taken for granted that generally the side that is ahead on material benefits from exchanges.

I think most viewers will see my cunning plan. White has placed every single piece and pawn on the DARK squares!!! This makes Black's bishop useless! This tends to be a very useful weapon to have in the arsenal for bishop endgames.
